nonWild ? sendQuest("@cya@safe", 199) : sendQuest("@red@Wilderness", 199);
[/quote] Why give him somthing that doesn’t work?[/quote]

Use the ?: operator instead of an if-then-else statement if it makes your code more readable;

item.title: How do i make the word on the bottom right turn red in wild
item.dc:creator: @hippyss hippyss
item.description:
@hippyss wrote:

Yeah hold on.
Edit:
Replace your WriteWildyLevel() void with this

public void WriteWildyLevel()
{
if(nonWild()){
outStream.createFrame(208);
outStream.writeWordBigEndian_dup(197);
sendQuest("@gre@Safe", 199);;
} else {
outStream.createFrame(208);
outStream.writeWordBigEndian_dup(197);
sendQuest("@red@Wild", 199);
}
}

then add

WriteWildyLevel();

to public boolean process
